title: Sweet Potato Pie Baking Tips

items.name: Roast the sweet potatoes
items.details: Wash, poke 6-8 holes about 1 inch deep with a fork, and bake at 400F for 45-60 minutes until soft. Roasting brings out natural sweetness.

items.name: Wrap in foil (optional)
items.details: Wrapping loosely in foil helps retain moisture. Leave some space for steam to escape.

items.name: Mash thoroughly
items.details: After roasting, remove skins and mash sweet potatoes thoroughly to avoid lumps in the filling.

items.name: Season with warm spices
items.details: Use a mix of cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger for warmth and depth of flavor.

items.name: Don't overmix the filling
items.details: Mix just until combined to keep the filling smooth and creamy.

items.name: Crust options
items.details: A graham cracker crust adds sweet crunch; a traditional pie crust offers a flaky experience. You can split filling between two regular crusts if you don't have a deep-dish.

items.name: Pre-bake the Pillsbury crust
items.details: Pre-bake in its metal tin on a baking sheet. Line with parchment and use pie weights or dried beans to prevent puffing. Remove weights for last few minutes to brown.

items.name: Graham cracker crust pre-bake
items.details: Store-bought graham cracker crusts are usually ready to use. Optionally pre-bake at 350F for 5-7 minutes for extra crispness.

items.name: Check for doneness
items.details: The pie is done when the filling is set around the edges but still slightly jiggly in the center. It firms up as it cools.

items.name: Storage
items.details: Refrigerate sweet potato pie after cooling completely. Cover loosely with plastic wrap or foil. Keeps 3-4 days in the fridge.

notes: If your recipe calls for a 9-inch deep-dish crust but you have regular crusts, split the filling between two regular crusts and reduce baking time slightly since the pies will be thinner.
